comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.naval-history.net/WW1Book-USOnTheCoast.htm "On July 14, 1917, the squadron commander, Captain W. B. Fletcher, U. S. N., with his staff, secured quarters on shore and began the first actual active cooperation with the French Navy against the enemy submarines." The page uses William as his first name. And www.navsource.org/archives/04/002/04002.htm provides Bartlett as a middle name. A son, William Bartlett Fletcher, Jr. was a naval officer in WWII. These naval historians clearly agree with the identification, storing a copy of this picture at www.navsource.org/archives/04/002/wbfletcher.jpg

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an article on him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Bartlett_Fletcher,_Sr. William Bartlett Fletcher, Sr. (1862 - June 29, 1957) was a Rear Admiral in the United States Navy.
